docs.title: 1.1 Work with a Single Author
docs.text:
Author prominent: author surname| (year)| ...

Example: Bryman (2012) recommends...

Information prominent: ...| (author surname,| year)

Example: ... (Bryman, 2012).

docs.title: 1.2 Work with Two Authors
docs.text:
Author prominent: author surname and author surname| (year)| ...

Example: Crisp and Turner (2014) note that being watched by others in a public event ...

Information prominent: ...| (author surname & author surname,| year)

Example: Nervousness can be caused by ... (Crisp & Turner, 2014).

docs.title: 1.3 Work with Three or More Authors
docs.text:
Author prominent: first author surname| et al.| (year)| ...

Example: Crisp et al. (1996) note that making a weight biography could assist with the recovery ...

Information prominent: ...| (first author surname| et al.,| year).

Example: ... a balanced diet will allow the nutritional balance to re-establish (Crisp et al., 1996).

docs.title: 1.4 No Date Can Be Found
docs.text:
use n.d. for "no date".

Example: ... (Wilkinson, n.d.).

docs.title: 2. Access
docs.text: APA Referencing 7th Edition

docs.title: 1.1 Parts of Statutes
docs.text:
Full Form Abbreviation part/parts pt/pts section/sections s/ss subsection/subsections sub-s/sub-ss paragraph/paragraphs para/paras subparagraph/subparagraphs subpara/subparas schedule/schedules sch/schs

Example 1: Consumer Protection Act 1987, s 2. Example 2: Human Rights Act 1998, s 15(1)(b). Example 3: Criminal Attempts Act 1981, ss 1(1) and 4(3). Example 4: Sexual Offences Act 2003, s 1(1)(c).

docs.title: 1.2 EU Cases
docs.text:
case number| case name| EU:C case number| report number| [exact paragraph].

Example 1: Case C-176/03 Commission v Council EU:C:2005:542, [2005] ECR I-7879. Example 2: Case C-542/09 Commission v the Netherlands EU:C:2012:346.

docs.title: 1.3.1 Authored Books
docs.text:
author,| title| (additional information,| edition,| publisher| year)| exact page.

Example 1: Timothy Endicott, Administrative Law (OUP 2009). Example 2: Gareth Jones, Goff and Jones: The Law of Restitution (1st supp, 7th edn, Sweet & Maxwell 2009).

docs.title: 1.3.2 Contributions to Edited Books
docs.text:
author,| ‘title’| in editor (ed),| book title| (additional information,| publisher| year)| exact page.

Example 1: Justine Pila, ‘The Value of Authorship in the Digital Environment’ in William H Dutton and Paul W Jeffreys (eds), World Wide Research: Reshaping the Sciences and Humanities in the Century of Information (MIT Press 2010). Example 2: John Cartwright, ‘The Fiction of the “Reasonable Man”’ in AG Castermans and others (eds), Ex Libris Hans Nieuwenhuis (Kluwer 2009).

docs.title: 1.3.3 Abbreviations
docs.text: Full Form Abbreviation part/parts  pt/pts  chapters/chapters  ch/chs  paragraph/paragraphs  para/paras  page/pages  stand alone, without p/pp

docs.title: 1.4 Journal Articles
docs.text:
author,| ‘title’| (year)| volume| journal name or abbreviation| first page of article,| exact page. [OR] author,| ‘title’| [year]| journal name or abbreviation| first page of article,| exact page.

Example 1: Paul Craig, ‘Theory, “Pure Theory” and Values in Public Law’ [2005] PL 440. Example 2: Alison L Young, ‘In Defence of Due Deference’ (2009) 72 MLR 554.

docs.title: 1.5 Working Papers
docs.text:
author,| ‘title’| (year)| publisher| additional information,| exact page| <link>| accessed accessed date.

Example: John M Finnis, ‘On Public Reason’ (2006) Oxford Legal Studies Research Paper 1/2007, 8 <http://ssrn.com/abstract=955815> accessed 18 November 2009.

docs.title: 1.6 European Commission Documents
docs.text:
Commission,| ‘title’| COM number,| exact page.

Example 1: Commission, ‘Proposal for a Council Decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Community, of the Protocol on the Implementation of the Alpine Convention in the Field of Transport (Transport Protocol)’ COM (2008) 895 final, ch I, art 3. Example 2: Commission, ‘Action Plan on consumer access to justice and the settlement of disputes in the internal market’ (Communication) COM (96) 13 final. Example 3: Commission, ‘Proposal for a Council Regulation on jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters’ COM (99) 348 final.

docs.title: 1.7 Conference Papers
docs.text:
author,| ‘titile’| (title of the conference,| location of the conference,| date of the conference)| exact page.

Example: Ben McFarlane and Donal Nolan, ‘Remedying Reliance: The Future Development of Promissory and Proprietary Estoppel in English Law’ (Obligations III conference, Brisbane, July 2006).
